subject: Problem accessing weblogic using JNDI
msgSnippet: I am having trouble accessing an EJB deployed in Weblogic 6.0 sith servicepack , using a JNDI call. If I run this method: public static void testDummyService()
messageBody:
I am having trouble accessing an EJB deployed in Weblogic 6.0 sith
servicepack , using a JNDI call.

If I run this method:

public static void testDummyService() throws Exception{
String testString = "four";
int expectedLength = 4;

AutomationSessionHome automationSessionHome =
(AutomationSessionHome) JndiUtil.lookupHome(

AUTOMATION_JNDI_NAME);

AutomationSession automationSession = (AutomationSession)
PortableRemoteObject.narrow(automationSessionHome.create(),

AutomationSession.class);
int receivedLength = automationSession.dummyService(testString);
automationSession.remove();
assertEquals("Received string length is different than expected",
expectedLength, receivedLength);
}



from the main method. It works fine. It also works fine if I use JUnit 3.2
to call this method. However, if I use Junit 3.4 or 3.5 or 3.6, I get a
ClassCastException on this line:

AutomationSession automationSession = (AutomationSession)
PortableRemoteObject.narrow(automationSessionHome.create(),

AutomationSession.class);

I know that I am getting the right object back from the server. I'm not
sure why I am getting this exception.

Any Suggestions?
